Q: How can one determine if the master controller is overloaded?
A1: Signs of an overloaded master controller include slow response times and failure to communicate with devices.
A2: An overloaded master may exhibit delayed responses or inability to manage connected devices effectively.
A3: If the master controller is struggling to process commands or dropping connections, it might be overloaded.
A4: Performance lags and communication breakdowns can indicate that the master controller is overloaded.
A5: Overload symptoms in the master controller include processing delays and intermittent device connectivity.
